title: fcp.plaid - Banking & Financial Data Connector
description:
# FCP Plaid Connector - Banking & Financial Data

## Overview
A secure, read-only financial data connector integrating with Plaid's API to provide agents access to bank accounts, transactions, investments, credit cards, and income verification with the highest level of audit and security controls.

## Priority: P1 (Critical Infrastructure)

## Core Capabilities

### 1. Account Information
- List linked bank accounts
- Account balances (current, available)
- Account details (type, subtype, mask)
- Institution information
- Account verification status

### 2. Transaction Data
- Historical transactions (up to 24 months)
- Real-time transaction updates
- Transaction categorization
- Merchant information
- Pending transactions
- Transaction search and filtering

### 3. Investment Holdings
- Brokerage account holdings
- Security details (ticker, CUSIP, ISIN)
- Current values and cost basis
- Quantity and price per share
- Investment account types (401k, IRA, brokerage)
- Performance calculations

### 4. Credit Card Data
- Credit card transactions
- Available credit
- Credit utilization
- Payment due dates
- Minimum payments

### 5. Income & Employment
- Income verification
- Employment verification
- Paystub data
- W-2 information
- Employer details

### 6. Liabilities
- Loan information (mortgage, auto, student)
- Outstanding balances
- Interest rates
- Payment schedules
- Origination details

## FCP Integration

### Manifest Structure
```toml
[connector]
name = "fcp.plaid"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "Secure banking and financial data access via Plaid"

[capabilities]
read_accounts = { risk = "high", description = "Read bank account information" }
read_transactions = { risk = "high", description = "Read transaction history" }
read_investments = { risk = "high", description = "Read investment holdings" }
read_liabilities = { risk = "high", description = "Read loan and liability data" }
verify_income = { risk = "high", description = "Verify income and employment" }

[trust_zones]
default = "z:financial:banking"
required_approval = true
audit_level = "complete"

[security]
read_only = true
encryption_required = true
pii_handling = "masked"
credential_storage = "vault_only"
```

### Trust Zone: z:financial:banking
This connector operates in the highest trust zone with:
- Explicit user approval for each access
- Complete audit trail of every API call
- No write operations permitted
- Encrypted data in transit and at rest
- Session-scoped access tokens
- Automatic credential rotation

### Tool Definitions
```yaml
tools:
  - name: plaid_list_accounts
    description: List all linked bank accounts
    parameters:
      include_balances: { type: boolean, default: true }
    audit: complete

  - name: plaid_get_transactions
    description: Get transactions for date range
    parameters:
      account_id: { type: string }
      start_date: { type: string, format: date, required: true }
      end_date: { type: string, format: date, required: true }
      count: { type: integer, default: 100, max: 500 }
      offset: { type: integer, default: 0 }
    audit: complete

  - name: plaid_get_balances
    description: Get current account balances
    parameters:
      account_ids: { type: array, items: string }
    audit: complete

  - name: plaid_get_investments
    description: Get investment holdings
    parameters:
      account_id: { type: string }
      include_securities: { type: boolean, default: true }
    audit: complete

  - name: plaid_get_liabilities
    description: Get liability/loan information
    parameters:
      account_id: { type: string }
    audit: complete

  - name: plaid_verify_income
    description: Get income verification data
    parameters:
      user_token: { type: string, required: true }
    audit: complete
    requires_approval: true

  - name: plaid_search_transactions
    description: Search transactions by criteria
    parameters:
      query: { type: string }
      category: { type: string }
      min_amount: { type: number }
      max_amount: { type: number }
      merchant: { type: string }
    audit: complete
```

## Security Architecture

### Authentication Flow
1. User initiates Plaid Link in trusted UI
2. Access token stored in secure vault (never exposed to agent)
3. Connector uses token reference, not actual token
4. All requests go through audit proxy
5. Tokens automatically refreshed, rotated

### Data Masking
- Account numbers: Show last 4 digits only
- Routing numbers: Fully masked
- SSN: Never exposed
- Full names: Configurable masking

### Audit Requirements
Every API call logs:
- Timestamp (UTC)
- User identity
- Agent identity
- Tool called
- Parameters (sanitized)
- Response summary
- Data accessed (account IDs, date ranges)
- IP address and session info

## Plaid Products Used
- Auth (account verification)
- Transactions
- Balance
- Investments
- Liabilities
- Income
- Identity

## Error Handling
- Rate limit handling with backoff
- Institution-specific error codes
- Stale data detection
- Link expiration handling
- Graceful degradation

## Dependencies
- plaid-rs (Plaid Rust SDK)
- reqwest (HTTP client)
- serde (serialization)
- vault integration for credentials

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] List all linked accounts with balances
- [ ] Retrieve 90 days of transactions
- [ ] Get investment holdings with current values
- [ ] Search transactions by merchant name
- [ ] Complete audit log for every access
- [ ] Proper error handling for expired links
- [ ] PII masking in all responses
- [ ] Rate limiting compliance

description:
## Overview
Meta-connector for intelligent routing between multiple AI/LLM providers, optimizing for cost, latency, and capability while enforcing budgets and providing usage analytics.

## Core Capabilities

### Cost-Based Routing
- Real-time pricing data per provider/model
- Token estimation before routing
- Cheapest-model selection for simple tasks
- Cost threshold triggers for model downgrade
- Batch request optimization for cost savings

### Latency-Based Routing
- Provider health monitoring
- Historical latency tracking per model
- Geographic routing optimization
- Time-of-day latency patterns
- Streaming vs batch latency considerations

### Capability-Based Routing
- Task classification (coding, writing, analysis, etc.)
- Model capability matrix maintenance
- Context window requirement matching
- Vision/multimodal capability detection
- Tool use capability routing
- Specialized model selection (code, math, etc.)

### Fallback Chains
- Primary/secondary/tertiary provider chains
- Automatic failover on errors
- Partial failure handling (retry vs fallback)
- Circuit breaker implementation
- Graceful degradation strategies
- Provider outage detection

### Budget Enforcement
- Per-user budget limits
- Per-project budget allocation
- Daily/weekly/monthly caps
- Real-time spend tracking
- Budget alert thresholds
- Hard vs soft limit modes

### Usage Tracking and Analytics
- Request logging with metadata
- Cost attribution by user/project/task
- Model performance comparison
- Success rate tracking
- Token usage patterns
- ROI analysis per model

## Supported Providers (Initial)
- Anthropic (Claude models)
- OpenAI (GPT models)
- Google (Gemini models)
- AWS Bedrock (multi-model)
- Azure OpenAI
- Local models (Ollama, vLLM)

## Implementation Notes
- Unified request/response format across providers
- Provider-specific adapters
- Async request handling
- Request queuing for rate limits
- Credential management per provider
- Caching layer for repeated queries

## Configuration
- YAML-based routing rules
- Dynamic rule updates without restart
- A/B testing support for routing strategies
- Custom routing logic plugins

## Testing Requirements
- Mock providers for unit tests
- Routing decision validation
- Budget enforcement tests
- Failover scenario tests
- Load testing for routing performance

fcp.webhook-receiver: Inbound Event Gateway
description:
# Inbound Event Gateway Meta-Connector

**Force Multiplier:** Universal webhook receiver for external service integrations.

## Overview

Many services push events via webhooks (GitHub, Stripe, Discord, Slack, etc.). Instead of building separate webhook handlers for each service, this meta-connector provides a unified HTTP endpoint infrastructure with per-service configuration.

## Core Components

### 1. HTTP Endpoint Management
- Dynamic endpoint creation/deletion
- Unique URL per webhook source
- Support for path-based routing (`/webhooks/{service}/{id}`)
- Health check endpoints
- CORS and preflight handling
- Rate limiting per endpoint

### 2. Signature Verification (Per-Service)
- Pluggable verification strategies:
  - HMAC-SHA256 (GitHub, Stripe)
  - HMAC-SHA1 (legacy services)
  - Ed25519 (Discord)
  - API key header
  - Basic auth
  - Custom verification functions
- Timing-safe comparison
- Signature caching for replay prevention
- Failed verification alerting

### 3. Payload Transformation
- JSON schema validation
- Payload normalization to common event format
- Field mapping/extraction
- Nested payload unwrapping
- Binary payload handling (multipart)
- Compression support (gzip, deflate)

### 4. Event Routing to Zones
- Route events to appropriate FCP zones
- Support multiple destinations per event type
- Filter events based on payload content
- Priority-based routing
- Fan-out to multiple handlers

### 5. Retry/Dead-Letter Handling
- Configurable retry strategies:
  - Exponential backoff
  - Fixed interval
  - Fibonacci backoff
- Dead letter queue for failed events
- Manual retry interface
- Event replay capability
- TTL-based expiration

## Configuration Example

```toml
[[webhooks]]
name = "github-repo-events"
path = "/webhooks/github/main-repo"
signature_type = "hmac-sha256"
signature_header = "X-Hub-Signature-256"
secret = "${GITHUB_WEBHOOK_SECRET}"
route_to = "zone.github-automation"
event_type_header = "X-GitHub-Event"

[[webhooks]]
name = "stripe-payments"
path = "/webhooks/stripe/payments"
signature_type = "stripe"
secret = "${STRIPE_WEBHOOK_SECRET}"
route_to = "zone.billing"
retry_max = 5
retry_backoff = "exponential"

[[webhooks]]
name = "discord-interactions"
path = "/webhooks/discord/bot"
signature_type = "ed25519"
public_key = "${DISCORD_PUBLIC_KEY}"
route_to = "zone.discord-bot"
```

## Event Format (Normalized)

```json
{
  "id": "evt_abc123",
  "source": "github",
  "type": "push",
  "timestamp": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
  "webhook_id": "github-repo-events",
  "payload": { ... },
  "metadata": {
    "delivery_id": "xyz789",
    "signature_valid": true,
    "received_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00.123Z"
  }
}
```

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Support 10+ common webhook signature types
- [ ] Sub-50ms processing latency
- [ ] 99.9% uptime for webhook endpoints
- [ ] Complete audit trail for all received webhooks
- [ ] Zero data loss with dead-letter queue
- [ ] Hot-reload of webhook configurations

## Dependencies

- HTTP server framework (axum/actix-web)
- Persistent queue for dead-letter handling
- Zone routing system

## Security Considerations

- All secrets stored encrypted
- IP allowlisting per webhook (optional)
- Request size limits
- Timeout handling
- DDoS protection integration

fcp.openai - OpenAI Provider Connector
description:
# FCP OpenAI Connector - OpenAI Provider

## Overview
A comprehensive connector for OpenAI's API suite, providing access to chat completions, assistants, fine-tuning, embeddings, audio processing, and image generation capabilities with unified cost tracking and quota management.

## Priority: P1 (Critical Infrastructure)

## Core Capabilities

### 1. Chat Completions
- GPT-4o, GPT-4, GPT-3.5 Turbo models
- Streaming responses
- Function calling
- JSON mode
- Vision (GPT-4o with images)
- System messages
- Temperature and sampling controls
- Logprobs and top logprobs
- Seed for reproducibility

### 2. Assistants API
- Create and manage assistants
- Thread management
- Message handling
- Run execution
- Code interpreter tool
- File search tool
- Function tools
- Streaming runs
- Run step inspection

### 3. Fine-Tuning Management
- Create fine-tuning jobs
- Monitor training progress
- List fine-tuned models
- Cancel jobs
- Training file upload
- Validation file upload
- Hyperparameter configuration
- Checkpoints and evaluation

### 4. Embeddings
- text-embedding-3-small
- text-embedding-3-large
- text-embedding-ada-002
- Batch embedding
- Dimension selection (for v3 models)

### 5. Audio (Whisper & TTS)
- Speech-to-text (Whisper)
  - Transcription
  - Translation
  - Multiple languages
  - Timestamps (word/segment level)
  - Multiple formats (json, text, srt, vtt)
- Text-to-speech
  - Multiple voices (alloy, echo, fable, onyx, nova, shimmer)
  - HD quality option
  - Speed control
  - MP3, Opus, AAC, FLAC, WAV, PCM

### 6. Image Generation (DALL-E)
- DALL-E 3 and DALL-E 2
- Text-to-image generation
- Image editing (inpainting)
- Image variations
- Multiple sizes (1024x1024, 1792x1024, 1024x1792)
- Quality settings (standard, hd)
- Style settings (vivid, natural)

## FCP Integration

### Manifest Structure
```toml
[connector]
name = "fcp.openai"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "OpenAI API integration for LLMs, audio, and images"

[capabilities]
chat = { risk = "medium", description = "Chat completions" }
assistants = { risk = "medium", description = "Assistants API" }
fine_tuning = { risk = "high", description = "Fine-tune models" }
embeddings = { risk = "low", description = "Generate embeddings" }
audio_transcribe = { risk = "low", description = "Transcribe audio" }
audio_tts = { risk = "low", description = "Generate speech" }
images = { risk = "medium", description = "Generate images" }

[trust_zones]
default = "z:ai:inference"
fine_tuning = "z:ai:training"
images = "z:ai:generation"

[resources]
rate_limit_rpm = 500
rate_limit_tpm = 90000
```

### Tool Definitions
```yaml
tools:
  # Chat Completions
  - name: openai_chat
    description: Send chat completion request
    parameters:
      model:
        type: string
        enum: [gpt-4o, gpt-4-turbo, gpt-4, gpt-3.5-turbo]
        required: true
      messages:
        type: array
        items:
          type: object
          properties:
            role: { type: string, enum: [system, user, assistant, function] }
            content: { type: string }
        required: true
      temperature: { type: number, default: 1.0 }
      max_tokens: { type: integer }
      stream: { type: boolean, default: false }
      functions: { type: array }
      function_call: { type: string }
      response_format: { type: object }

  - name: openai_chat_vision
    description: Chat with images
    parameters:
      model: { type: string, default: "gpt-4o" }
      messages:
        type: array
        items:
          type: object
          properties:
            role: { type: string }
            content:
              type: array
              items:
                type: object

  # Assistants API
  - name: openai_assistant_create
    description: Create a new assistant
    parameters:
      name: { type: string, required: true }
      instructions: { type: string }
      model: { type: string, required: true }
      tools: { type: array }
      file_ids: { type: array }

  - name: openai_thread_create
    description: Create a conversation thread
    parameters:
      messages: { type: array }

  - name: openai_thread_run
    description: Run assistant on thread
    parameters:
      thread_id: { type: string, required: true }
      assistant_id: { type: string, required: true }
      instructions: { type: string }
      stream: { type: boolean, default: false }

  - name: openai_run_status
    description: Get run status
    parameters:
      thread_id: { type: string, required: true }
      run_id: { type: string, required: true }

  # Fine-Tuning
  - name: openai_finetune_create
    description: Create fine-tuning job
    parameters:
      training_file: { type: string, required: true }
      model: { type: string, required: true }
      validation_file: { type: string }
      hyperparameters:
        type: object
        properties:
          n_epochs: { type: integer }
          batch_size: { type: integer }
          learning_rate_multiplier: { type: number }

  - name: openai_finetune_list
    description: List fine-tuning jobs
    parameters:
      limit: { type: integer, default: 20 }

  - name: openai_finetune_status
    description: Get fine-tuning job status
    parameters:
      job_id: { type: string, required: true }

  # Embeddings
  - name: openai_embed
    description: Generate embeddings
    parameters:
      model:
        type: string
        enum: [text-embedding-3-small, text-embedding-3-large, text-embedding-ada-002]
        default: text-embedding-3-small
      input:
        oneOf:
          - type: string
          - type: array
            items: { type: string }
        required: true
      dimensions: { type: integer }

  # Audio
  - name: openai_transcribe
    description: Transcribe audio to text
    parameters:
      file: { type: string, required: true, description: "Path or base64" }
      model: { type: string, default: "whisper-1" }
      language: { type: string }
      response_format: { type: string, enum: [json, text, srt, vtt] }
      timestamp_granularities: { type: array }

  - name: openai_translate
    description: Translate audio to English
    parameters:
      file: { type: string, required: true }
      model: { type: string, default: "whisper-1" }

  - name: openai_tts
    description: Generate speech from text
    parameters:
      model: { type: string, enum: [tts-1, tts-1-hd], default: "tts-1" }
      input: { type: string, required: true, maxLength: 4096 }
      voice: 
        type: string
        enum: [alloy, echo, fable, onyx, nova, shimmer]
        required: true
      response_format: { type: string, enum: [mp3, opus, aac, flac, wav, pcm] }
      speed: { type: number, min: 0.25, max: 4.0, default: 1.0 }

  # Images
  - name: openai_image_generate
    description: Generate image from prompt
    parameters:
      model: { type: string, enum: [dall-e-3, dall-e-2], default: "dall-e-3" }
      prompt: { type: string, required: true, maxLength: 4000 }
      n: { type: integer, default: 1, max: 10 }
      size: 
        type: string
        enum: [1024x1024, 1792x1024, 1024x1792, 512x512, 256x256]
      quality: { type: string, enum: [standard, hd] }
      style: { type: string, enum: [vivid, natural] }

  - name: openai_image_edit
    description: Edit image with mask
    parameters:
      image: { type: string, required: true }
      mask: { type: string }
      prompt: { type: string, required: true }
      n: { type: integer, default: 1 }
      size: { type: string }

  # Usage
  - name: openai_get_usage
    description: Get current usage statistics
    parameters:
      period: { type: string, enum: [session, day, month] }
```

## Cost Tracking

### Pricing Model (as of implementation)
| Model | Input | Output |
|-------|-------|--------|
| gpt-4o | $2.50/1M | $10.00/1M |
| gpt-4-turbo | $10.00/1M | $30.00/1M |
| gpt-4 | $30.00/1M | $60.00/1M |
| gpt-3.5-turbo | $0.50/1M | $1.50/1M |
| text-embedding-3-small | $0.02/1M | - |
| text-embedding-3-large | $0.13/1M | - |
| whisper | $0.006/min | - |
| tts-1 | $15.00/1M chars | - |
| dall-e-3 | $0.04-0.12/image | - |

## Error Handling
- Rate limits (429): Exponential backoff with jitter
- Context length: Auto-truncation or error
- Content policy (400): Report violation
- Service unavailable (503): Retry with backoff
- Invalid API key (401): Credential refresh

## Dependencies
- async-openai or custom HTTP client
- reqwest (HTTP)
- tokio (async)
- serde (serialization)
- base64 (file encoding)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Complete chat with streaming
- [ ] Use functions in chat
- [ ] Create and run assistant
- [ ] Generate embeddings for text
- [ ] Transcribe audio file
- [ ] Generate speech from text
- [ ] Generate image from prompt
- [ ] Track costs per operation
- [ ] Handle rate limits
- [ ] Fine-tune a model (e2e)

title: fcp.mcp-bridge: MCP Gateway Meta-Connector
description:
# MCP Gateway Meta-Connector

**Force Multiplier:** Connect to ANY MCP server and expose its tools via FCP.

## Overview

This meta-connector acts as a universal bridge between the MCP (Model Context Protocol) ecosystem and FCP. Instead of building individual connectors for each service, we can leverage the growing MCP ecosystem by connecting to existing MCP servers.

## Core Components

### 1. MCP Client in Rust
- Implement full MCP client protocol in Rust
- Support stdio, HTTP, and SSE transports
- Handle MCP handshake and capability negotiation
- Manage connection lifecycle (connect, reconnect, disconnect)
- Support multiple concurrent MCP server connections

### 2. Dynamic Tool Discovery
- Query MCP server for available tools on connection
- Subscribe to tool availability changes
- Cache tool definitions with TTL
- Handle tool versioning and deprecation
- Support lazy loading of tool schemas

### 3. Schema Translation (MCP â†’ FCP)
- Map MCP tool schemas to FCP action definitions
- Convert MCP parameter types to FCP types
- Handle required vs optional parameters
- Translate MCP error codes to FCP error responses
- Preserve metadata and documentation

### 4. Capability Mapping
- Map MCP capabilities to FCP permissions
- Handle capability negotiation
- Support capability-based access control
- Document capability requirements per tool

### 5. Zone Isolation
- Each MCP server = separate FCP zone
- Namespace tools by server (e.g., `mcp.github.create_issue`)
- Isolate credentials per zone
- Independent rate limiting per zone
- Zone-level health monitoring

### 6. Audit Trail
- Log all MCP tool invocations
- Capture request/response pairs
- Track latency and error rates
- Support structured logging (JSON)
- Integrate with FCP audit system

## Configuration Example

```toml
[[mcp_servers]]
name = "github"
transport = "stdio"
command = "npx"
args = ["-y", "@modelcontextprotocol/server-github"]
env = { GITHUB_TOKEN = "${GITHUB_TOKEN}" }
zone = "mcp.github"

[[mcp_servers]]
name = "filesystem"
transport = "stdio"
command = "npx"
args = ["-y", "@modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem", "/allowed/path"]
zone = "mcp.filesystem"
```

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Connect to any compliant MCP server
- [ ] Expose MCP tools as FCP actions
- [ ] Zero manual configuration per MCP tool
- [ ] Sub-100ms overhead for tool invocation
- [ ] Graceful handling of MCP server failures
- [ ] Complete audit trail for compliance

## Dependencies

- MCP specification documentation
- FCP action definition format
- Zone management system

## References

- [MCP Specification](https://modelcontextprotocol.io/)
- [MCP Server Examples](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers)

fcp.semanticscholar: Research Literature Connector
description:
## Overview
Academic research connector for Semantic Scholar API, providing semantic paper search, citation analysis, and author profiling to complement the arxiv connector.

## Core Capabilities

### Paper Search with Semantic Understanding
- Natural language query support
- Semantic similarity matching (not just keywords)
- Field-of-study filtering
- Publication date range filtering
- Venue and journal filtering
- Open access filter option

### Citation Graph and References
- Retrieve citing papers (who cited this)
- Retrieve referenced papers (bibliography)
- Citation context extraction
- Multi-hop citation traversal
- Co-citation analysis
- Bibliographic coupling detection

### Author Profiles and Metrics
- Author search by name and affiliation
- H-index and citation count retrieval
- Publication history timeline
- Co-author network mapping
- Author disambiguation
- ORCID linking where available

### Topic Classification
- Automatic topic/field assignment
- Hierarchical topic taxonomy
- Cross-disciplinary paper detection
- Emerging topic identification
- Topic trend analysis over time

### Open Access Paper Retrieval
- Identify open access versions
- Direct PDF URL when available
- Preprint linking (arxiv, bioRxiv, etc.)
- License information extraction
- Full text availability status

## Integration with Arxiv Connector
- Cross-reference arxiv IDs with S2 paper IDs
- Enrich arxiv results with citation data
- Use S2 for citation metrics, arxiv for full text
- Unified paper identifier mapping

## Implementation Notes
- Use Semantic Scholar Academic Graph API
- Respect rate limits (100 req/5min for unauthenticated)
- API key support for higher limits
- Batch request support for efficiency
- Handle partial data gracefully

## Testing Requirements
- Mock API responses for unit tests
- Rate limit handling tests
- Citation graph traversal tests
- Search relevance validation

title: Add message length validation

title: fcp.stripe - Stripe Payment Platform Connector
description:
# fcp.stripe - Stripe Payment Platform Connector

## Overview
Comprehensive Stripe integration for payment processing, subscription management, and financial reporting with enterprise-grade security.

## Archetype
**Hybrid: Request-Response + Webhook**
- Request-Response: All payment and customer operations
- Webhook: Payment events, subscription lifecycle, disputes

## Key Operations

### Payment Operations
- `stripe.payment.create` - Create PaymentIntent
- `stripe.payment.confirm` - Confirm payment
- `stripe.payment.capture` - Capture authorized payment
- `stripe.payment.cancel` - Cancel payment
- `stripe.payment.refund` - Process refund
- `stripe.payment.list` - List payments with filters

### Subscription Operations
- `stripe.subscription.create` - Create subscription
- `stripe.subscription.update` - Modify subscription
- `stripe.subscription.cancel` - Cancel subscription
- `stripe.subscription.pause` - Pause collection
- `stripe.subscription.resume` - Resume paused subscription
- `stripe.subscription.items` - Manage subscription items
- `stripe.subscription.schedule` - Schedule future changes

### Customer Operations
- `stripe.customer.create` - Create customer
- `stripe.customer.update` - Update customer data
- `stripe.customer.delete` - Delete customer
- `stripe.customer.get` - Retrieve customer
- `stripe.customer.list` - List customers
- `stripe.customer.payment_methods` - Manage payment methods
- `stripe.customer.portal` - Generate billing portal session

### Invoice Operations
- `stripe.invoice.create` - Create invoice
- `stripe.invoice.finalize` - Finalize draft invoice
- `stripe.invoice.send` - Send invoice to customer
- `stripe.invoice.pay` - Pay invoice
- `stripe.invoice.void` - Void invoice
- `stripe.invoice.list` - List invoices
- `stripe.invoice.upcoming` - Preview upcoming invoice
- `stripe.invoice.items` - Manage invoice line items

### Product & Price Operations
- `stripe.product.create` - Create product
- `stripe.product.update` - Update product
- `stripe.product.list` - List products
- `stripe.price.create` - Create price
- `stripe.price.update` - Update price
- `stripe.price.list` - List prices

### Reporting Operations
- `stripe.balance.get` - Get account balance
- `stripe.balance.transactions` - List balance transactions
- `stripe.payout.list` - List payouts
- `stripe.report.run` - Generate report
- `stripe.report.download` - Download report file

### Checkout Operations
- `stripe.checkout.session.create` - Create checkout session
- `stripe.checkout.session.get` - Retrieve session
- `stripe.checkout.session.expire` - Expire session

### Webhook Operations
- `stripe.webhook.construct_event` - Verify and parse webhook
- `stripe.webhook.endpoints` - Manage webhook endpoints

## Webhook Event Handling
```
payment_intent.succeeded    -> Update payment status
payment_intent.failed       -> Handle failure, notify
customer.subscription.*     -> Sync subscription state
invoice.paid               -> Record payment, update access
invoice.payment_failed     -> Dunning flow trigger
charge.dispute.created     -> Alert, begin resolution
customer.created/updated   -> Sync customer data
```

## Idempotency Management
- Automatic idempotency key generation
- Key storage and retrieval for retries
- Configurable key format per operation
- Retry-safe operation wrapper

## Zone Architecture (Financial Security)
```
Zone 0 (Public):     Product catalog, public prices
Zone 1 (Authorized): Customer payment history (own data)
Zone 2 (Private):    Customer PII, payment methods
Zone 3 (Sensitive):  API keys, webhook signing secrets
Zone 4 (Financial):  Transaction data, bank details (enhanced encryption)
```

### Financial Data Handling
- PCI DSS compliance considerations
- No raw card numbers in logs
- Tokenized payment method references
- Audit trail for all financial operations
- Encryption at rest for sensitive fields

## Dependencies
- `fcp-core`: Base connector traits
- `fcp-webhook`: Webhook signature verification
- `fcp-crypto`: Enhanced encryption for Zone 4
- `fcp-audit`: Financial audit logging

## Integration Points
- **Flywheel Billing**: Primary billing backend
- **Flywheel Analytics**: Revenue metrics pipeline
- **fcp.slack**: Payment notifications
- **fcp.email**: Invoice delivery, receipts

## Implementation Notes
- Use Stripe API version pinning (2023-10-16)
- Implement automatic pagination for list operations
- Handle Stripe rate limits (100 req/sec read, 100 write)
- Support Connect for marketplace scenarios
- Implement test mode detection and handling
- Support expand[] for nested object retrieval
- Handle currency conversion and formatting

title: fcp.1password: Credential Management Connector
description:
## Overview
Secure credential management connector for 1Password integration, enabling AI agents to safely access and manage secrets without exposing sensitive data.

## Core Capabilities

### Item Lookup (Read-Only by Default)
- Search vault items by name, tags, or categories
- Retrieve specific fields (username, URL, notes) without exposing passwords
- Read-only access as the default permission level
- Explicit elevation required for password retrieval

### Password Generation
- Generate strong passwords with configurable requirements
- Support for length, character sets, and complexity rules
- Memorable password generation (word-based)
- PIN generation for numeric-only contexts

### Entry Creation
- Create new login entries with generated passwords
- Support for secure notes, credit cards, identities
- Custom field support for application-specific data
- Automatic categorization and tagging

### Vault Organization
- List and navigate vault structure
- Move items between vaults
- Bulk tagging operations
- Archive and restore items

### Secure Note Access
- Read secure notes for configuration data
- Structured note parsing (YAML, JSON embedded)
- Document attachment retrieval
- Version history access

## Security Requirements

### Credential Protection
- **CRITICAL**: Never expose credentials in logs or output
- Mask all sensitive fields in debug output
- Use secure memory handling
- Clear credentials from memory after use

### Time-Limited Credential Leases
- Short-lived access tokens (5-minute default)
- Automatic credential rotation
- Lease renewal with re-authentication
- Audit trail for all credential access

## Implementation Notes
- Use 1Password CLI (op) or Connect API
- Support both personal and team accounts
- Service account integration for automation
- MFA handling for interactive sessions

## Testing Requirements
- Mock vault for unit tests
- Integration tests with test vault
- Security audit for credential handling
- Penetration testing for leak prevention

title: fcp.microsoft365: Microsoft 365 Suite Integration Connector
description:
# FCP Microsoft 365 Suite Integration Connector ## Overview Comprehensive enterprise connector for Microsoft 365 suite, providing unified access through Microsoft Graph API. Critical for enterprise adoption with support for Outlook, OneDrive, Excel, Word, OneNote, SharePoint, and MS Planner. ## Sub-Connectors Architecture ### 1. Outlook (Email & Calendar) #### Email Operations - **Read Messages**: Inbox, folders, search - **Send Messages**: Compose, reply, forward - **Manage Messages**: Move, delete, archive - **Attachments**: Upload, download, inline - **Mail Folders**: Create, organize, rules #### Calendar Operations - **Events**: Create, update, delete, RSVP - **Calendars**: Multiple calendar support - **Availability**: Free/busy lookup - **Scheduling**: Find meeting times - **Recurring Events**: Complex patterns #### Contacts - **Contact Management**: CRUD operations - **Contact Folders**: Organization - **Contact Groups**: Distribution lists ### 2. OneDrive (File Storage) #### File Operations - **Upload**: Simple and resumable - **Download**: Direct and streaming - **Copy/Move**: Within and across drives - **Delete**: Soft delete and restore - **Sharing**: Links, permissions #### Folder Management - **Create/Delete Folders** - **List Contents**: Pagination support - **Search**: Full-text search - **Delta Sync**: Track changes #### Special Folders - Documents, Pictures, Desktop - App-specific folders - Shared folders ### 3. Excel Online #### Workbook Operations - **Open/Create Workbooks** - **List Worksheets** - **Workbook Sessions**: Persistent editing #### Data Operations ```python # Read range GET /workbook/worksheets/{id}/range(address='A1:D10') # Update range PATCH /workbook/worksheets/{id}/range(address='A1:D10') { "values": [["A", "B"], ["C", "D"]] } ``` #### Table Operations - **Create Tables**: From ranges - **Add Rows**: Append data - **Sort/Filter**: Data manipulation - **Calculated Columns**: Formulas #### Charts & Pivots - Create charts from data - Pivot table operations ### 4. Word Online #### Document Operations - **Create Documents**: From templates - **Read Content**: Full text extraction - **Update Content**: Append, replace - **Export**: PDF, other formats #### Content Controls - Find and replace - Bookmark management - Comment operations ### 5. OneNote #### Notebook Operations - **List Notebooks**: Personal and shared - **Create Notebooks** - **Sections**: Create, organize - **Section Groups**: Nested organization #### Page Operations ```python # Create page with HTML content POST /sections/{id}/pages Content-Type: text/html Page Title

Heading

Content here

``` #### Content - Rich text with HTML - Images and attachments - Ink and handwriting - Tags and to-do items ### 6. SharePoint #### Site Operations - **List Sites**: All accessible sites - **Site Details**: Properties, permissions - **Subsites**: Create, manage #### Lists & Libraries - **Document Libraries**: File storage - **Custom Lists**: Structured data - **List Items**: CRUD operations - **Views**: Custom views #### Pages & News - **Site Pages**: Create, update - **News Posts**: Publishing - **Web Parts**: Content blocks ### 7. MS Planner #### Plan Operations - **Create Plans**: Within Groups - **List Plans**: User's plans - **Plan Details**: Buckets, tasks #### Task Operations ```python { "planId": "...", "bucketId": "...", "title": "Task title", "assignments": { "user-id": { "@odata.type": "#microsoft.graph.plannerAssignment", "orderHint": " !" } }, "dueDateTime": "2024-12-31T00:00:00Z" } ``` #### Bucket Management - Create/organize buckets - Move tasks between buckets - Bucket ordering ## Microsoft Graph API (Unified Endpoint) ### Base Configuration ```yaml graph_api: base_url: "https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0" beta_url: "https://graph.microsoft.com/beta" scopes: - "User.Read" - "Mail.ReadWrite" - "Files.ReadWrite.All" - "Calendars.ReadWrite" - "Sites.ReadWrite.All" - "Tasks.ReadWrite" ``` ### Batch Requests ```python POST /$batch { "requests": [ {"id": "1", "method": "GET", "url": "/me/messages"}, {"id": "2", "method": "GET", "url": "/me/events"}, {"id": "3", "method": "GET", "url": "/me/drive/root/children"} ] } ``` ## OAuth 2.0 with Refresh Tokens ### Authorization Flow ``` 1. GET /authorize?client_id=...&scope=...&redirect_uri=... 2. User consents 3. POST /token (authorization_code grant) 4. Store refresh_token securely 5. POST /token (refresh_token grant) when access_token expires ``` ### Token Management ```yaml auth: type: "oauth2" client_id: "${AZURE_CLIENT_ID}" client_secret: "${AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET}" tenant_id: "${AZURE_TENANT_ID}" redirect_uri: "http://localhost:8080/callback" token_storage: type: "encrypted_file" path: "/secure/tokens.enc" auto_refresh: true refresh_buffer_seconds: 300 ``` ### Scopes by Sub-connector | Sub-connector | Required Scopes | |---------------|-----------------| | Outlook Mail | Mail.Read, Mail.ReadWrite, Mail.Send | | Outlook Calendar | Calendars.Read, Calendars.ReadWrite | | OneDrive | Files.Read, Files.ReadWrite, Files.ReadWrite.All | | Excel | Files.ReadWrite | | Word | Files.ReadWrite | | OneNote | Notes.Read, Notes.ReadWrite | | SharePoint | Sites.Read.All, Sites.ReadWrite.All | | Planner | Tasks.Read, Tasks.ReadWrite, Group.ReadWrite.All | ## Webhook Subscriptions (Real-time Events) ### Subscription Management ```python # Create subscription POST /subscriptions { "changeType": "created,updated,deleted", "notificationUrl": "https://webhook.example.com/m365", "resource": "/me/messages", "expirationDateTime": "2024-12-31T00:00:00Z", "clientState": "secret-validation-token" } ``` ### Supported Resources - `/me/messages`: Email changes - `/me/events`: Calendar changes - `/me/contacts`: Contact changes - `/drives/{id}/root`: OneDrive changes - `/sites/{id}/lists/{id}/items`: SharePoint changes - `/groups/{id}/planner/tasks`: Planner changes ### Webhook Handler ```python async def handle_webhook(request): # Validation challenge if 'validationToken' in request.query: return PlainTextResponse(request.query['validationToken']) # Process notifications for notification in request.json()['value']: resource = notification['resource'] change_type = notification['changeType'] # Process change... ``` ### Subscription Renewal - Max lifetime: 3 days (most resources) - Auto-renewal before expiration - Webhook validation handling ## Configuration Schema ```yaml fcp.microsoft365: tenant_id: "${AZURE_TENANT_ID}" client_id: "${AZURE_CLIENT_ID}" client_secret: "${AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET}" auth: type: "oauth2" redirect_uri: "http://localhost:8080/callback" token_cache: "/secure/token_cache.json" sub_connectors: outlook: enabled: true mail_folders: ["Inbox", "Sent Items"] calendar_sync: true onedrive: enabled: true root_path: "/Documents" excel: enabled: true word: enabled: true onenote: enabled: true sharepoint: enabled: true sites: ["https://tenant.sharepoint.com/sites/team"] planner: enabled: true webhooks: enabled: true endpoint_url: "https://webhook.example.com/m365" resources: - "/me/messages" - "/me/events" rate_limits: requests_per_second: 10 concurrent_connections: 5 ``` ## MCP Tool Definitions ### Outlook Tools - `outlook_list_messages`: List emails - `outlook_send_message`: Send email - `outlook_create_event`: Create calendar event - `outlook_get_availability`: Check free/busy ### OneDrive Tools - `onedrive_list_files`: List directory contents - `onedrive_upload_file`: Upload file - `onedrive_download_file`: Download file - `onedrive_share_file`: Create sharing link ### Excel Tools - `excel_read_range`: Read cell range - `excel_write_range`: Write to cells - `excel_create_table`: Create data table - `excel_run_function`: Execute formula ### SharePoint Tools - `sharepoint_list_sites`: List sites - `sharepoint_get_list_items`: Read list data - `sharepoint_create_list_item`: Add list item ### Planner Tools - `planner_list_tasks`: List user tasks - `planner_create_task`: Create new task - `planner_update_task`: Update task status ### Webhook Tools - `m365_create_subscription`: Create webhook - `m365_list_subscriptions`: List active webhooks - `m365_delete_subscription`: Remove webhook ## Enterprise Features ### Multi-tenant Support - Per-tenant configuration - Tenant isolation - Cross-tenant operations (with consent) ### Compliance & Governance - Audit logging - Data residency awareness - eDiscovery integration ### Delegated vs Application Permissions - User context operations - Background service operations - Admin consent flows ## Error Handling - Token refresh failures - Rate limit (429) handling - Throttling with Retry-After - Permission denied errors - Resource not found ## Implementation Phases ### Phase 1: Core Auth (Week 1-2) - [ ] OAuth 2.0 flow implementation - [ ] Token storage and refresh - [ ] Multi-tenant support - [ ] Permission management ### Phase 2: Outlook (Week 3-4) - [ ] Mail operations - [ ] Calendar operations - [ ] Contact operations ### Phase 3: OneDrive & Files (Week 5-6) - [ ] File operations - [ ] Excel integration - [ ] Word integration ### Phase 4: Collaboration (Week 7-8) - [ ] SharePoint integration - [ ] OneNote integration - [ ] Planner integration ### Phase 5: Real-time (Week 9-10) - [ ] Webhook subscriptions - [ ] Change notifications - [ ] Delta sync ### Phase 6: Enterprise (Week 11-12) - [ ] Compliance features - [ ] Monitoring - [ ] Documentation ## Dependencies - msal (Microsoft Authentication Library) - httpx (async HTTP client) - cryptography (token encryption) - pydantic (data validation) ## Success Metrics - OAuth flow success rate > 99% - API call latency < 500ms - Webhook delivery success > 99.9% - Support all listed sub-connectors - Enterprise security compliance

fcp.google-ai: Google AI/Gemini Provider Connector
description:
# FCP Google AI/Gemini Provider Connector

## Overview
Enterprise-grade connector for Google's AI services including Gemini models, Vertex AI platform, embeddings, and multimodal capabilities. Provides unified access to Google's generative AI ecosystem.

## Core Capabilities

### 1. Gemini Models Integration
- **Gemini Pro**: Text generation, reasoning, code generation
- **Gemini Pro Vision**: Image understanding and analysis
- **Gemini Ultra**: Advanced reasoning and complex tasks
- **Gemini Nano**: Edge/mobile optimized models
- Model version management and fallback strategies
- Token counting and usage tracking
- Streaming responses support

### 2. Vertex AI Platform
- **Model Garden Access**: Pre-trained and fine-tuned models
- **Custom Model Deployment**: Deploy custom models
- **Model Endpoints**: Manage prediction endpoints
- **Batch Prediction**: Large-scale inference jobs
- **Model Evaluation**: Performance metrics and benchmarks
- **Feature Store Integration**: Managed feature serving

### 3. Embeddings Service
- **Text Embeddings**: textembedding-gecko models
- **Multimodal Embeddings**: Combined text/image embeddings
- **Batch Embedding**: Efficient bulk embedding generation
- **Dimensionality Options**: 256, 512, 768, 1024 dimensions
- **Task-specific Embeddings**: Retrieval, similarity, classification

### 4. Multimodal Capabilities
- **Video Understanding**:
  - Video summarization
  - Temporal analysis
  - Object tracking descriptions
  - Scene detection
- **Audio Processing**:
  - Speech transcription
  - Audio understanding
  - Multi-speaker detection
- **Image Analysis**:
  - Object detection descriptions
  - OCR and document understanding
  - Image captioning
  - Visual Q&A

## Authentication & Security

### Service Account Authentication
```python
{
    "type": "service_account",
    "project_id": "...",
    "private_key_id": "...",
    "private_key": "...",
    "client_email": "...",
    "auth_uri": "...",
    "token_uri": "..."
}
```

### API Key Authentication
- Simple API key for development
- Key rotation support
- Usage quotas per key

### OAuth 2.0 (User Context)
- User-delegated access
- Consent screen integration
- Token refresh handling

## Configuration Schema
```yaml
fcp.google-ai:
  project_id: "my-gcp-project"
  location: "us-central1"
  auth:
    type: "service_account"  # or "api_key", "oauth"
    credentials_path: "/path/to/credentials.json"
  
  models:
    default: "gemini-pro"
    fallback: "gemini-pro-vision"
    
  vertex_ai:
    enabled: true
    endpoint_id: "..."
    
  embeddings:
    model: "textembedding-gecko@003"
    dimensions: 768
    
  rate_limits:
    requests_per_minute: 60
    tokens_per_minute: 100000
    
  safety_settings:
    harm_block_threshold: "BLOCK_MEDIUM_AND_ABOVE"
```

## MCP Tool Definitions

### Text Generation
- `google_ai_generate`: Generate text with Gemini models
- `google_ai_chat`: Multi-turn conversation
- `google_ai_stream`: Streaming generation

### Embeddings
- `google_ai_embed_text`: Generate text embeddings
- `google_ai_embed_batch`: Batch embedding generation
- `google_ai_embed_multimodal`: Combined embeddings

### Multimodal
- `google_ai_analyze_image`: Image analysis
- `google_ai_analyze_video`: Video understanding
- `google_ai_transcribe_audio`: Audio transcription

### Vertex AI
- `vertex_predict`: Custom model prediction
- `vertex_batch_predict`: Batch predictions
- `vertex_list_models`: List available models

## Safety & Content Filtering
- Configurable safety settings per category:
  - Harassment
  - Hate speech
  - Sexually explicit
  - Dangerous content
- Block thresholds: NONE, LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH
- Safety feedback in responses

## Error Handling
- Quota exceeded handling with backoff
- Model unavailable fallback
- Region failover support
- Detailed error categorization

## Monitoring & Observability
- Request/response logging
- Token usage metrics
- Latency tracking
- Cost estimation
- Model performance metrics

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Core Gemini (Week 1-2)
- [ ] Authentication setup (all methods)
- [ ] Gemini Pro text generation
- [ ] Streaming support
- [ ] Basic error handling

### Phase 2: Embeddings (Week 3)
- [ ] Text embeddings API
- [ ] Batch processing
- [ ] Dimension configuration

### Phase 3: Multimodal (Week 4-5)
- [ ] Image analysis
- [ ] Video understanding
- [ ] Audio transcription

### Phase 4: Vertex AI (Week 6-7)
- [ ] Model deployment
- [ ] Custom endpoints
- [ ] Batch prediction

### Phase 5: Production (Week 8)
- [ ] Safety settings
- [ ] Rate limiting
- [ ] Monitoring integration
- [ ] Documentation

## Dependencies
- google-cloud-aiplatform SDK
- google-generativeai SDK
- Protocol Buffers
- gRPC

## Success Metrics
- API response latency < 500ms (excluding generation)
- 99.9% authentication success rate
- Support for all Gemini model variants
- Complete multimodal coverage

fcp.pinecone: Pinecone Vector Database Connector
description:
# FCP Pinecone Vector Database Connector

## Overview
Production-grade connector for Pinecone, the leading managed vector database for AI applications. Enables semantic search, recommendation systems, and RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) workflows.

## Core Capabilities

### 1. Semantic Search
- **Dense Vector Search**: High-dimensional similarity search
- **Top-K Retrieval**: Configurable result counts
- **Score Thresholds**: Filter by similarity scores
- **Include Metadata**: Return associated metadata
- **Include Values**: Optionally return vectors

### 2. Vector Operations

#### Upsert Vectors
```python
{
    "vectors": [
        {
            "id": "vec1",
            "values": [0.1, 0.2, ...],
            "metadata": {"category": "tech", "source": "doc1"}
        }
    ],
    "namespace": "production"
}
```

#### Delete Vectors
- Delete by ID (single or batch)
- Delete by metadata filter
- Delete entire namespace
- Delete all vectors in index

#### Update Vectors
- Update metadata only
- Update values only
- Full vector replacement

### 3. Namespace Management
- **Create Namespace**: Logical partitioning
- **List Namespaces**: Enumerate all namespaces
- **Namespace Statistics**: Vector counts, dimensions
- **Delete Namespace**: Remove all vectors in namespace
- **Cross-namespace Queries**: Search across namespaces

### 4. Metadata Filtering
```python
{
    "filter": {
        "category": {"$eq": "technology"},
        "date": {"$gte": "2024-01-01"},
        "tags": {"$in": ["ai", "ml"]},
        "$and": [
            {"price": {"$lte": 100}},
            {"stock": {"$gt": 0}}
        ]
    }
}
```

**Supported Operators:**
- `$eq`, `$ne`: Equality
- `$gt`, `$gte`, `$lt`, `$lte`: Comparison
- `$in`, `$nin`: Set membership
- `$and`, `$or`: Logical combinators

### 5. Hybrid Search (Dense + Sparse)
- **Sparse Vectors**: BM25/TF-IDF style
- **Dense Vectors**: Neural embeddings
- **Alpha Blending**: Configurable weighting
- **Reranking**: Combined score optimization

```python
{
    "vector": [0.1, 0.2, ...],        # Dense
    "sparse_vector": {                 # Sparse
        "indices": [1, 5, 100],
        "values": [0.5, 0.3, 0.8]
    },
    "alpha": 0.7  # Dense weight
}
```

### 6. Collection Management
- **Create Index**: Configure dimensions, metric, pods
- **Delete Index**: Remove entire index
- **Describe Index**: Get index configuration
- **List Indexes**: Enumerate all indexes
- **Configure Index**: Update replicas, pod type

## Authentication & Security

### API Key Authentication
```yaml
auth:
  api_key: "pc-xxxxx"
  environment: "us-east-1-aws"
```

### Project-based Access
- Organization management
- Project isolation
- Role-based access control

## Configuration Schema
```yaml
fcp.pinecone:
  api_key: "${PINECONE_API_KEY}"
  environment: "us-east-1-aws"
  
  index:
    name: "production-index"
    dimension: 1536
    metric: "cosine"  # cosine, euclidean, dotproduct
    
  defaults:
    namespace: "default"
    top_k: 10
    include_metadata: true
    include_values: false
    
  batch_settings:
    upsert_batch_size: 100
    query_batch_size: 10
    
  retry:
    max_attempts: 3
    backoff_multiplier: 2
```

## MCP Tool Definitions

### Search Operations
- `pinecone_query`: Semantic similarity search
- `pinecone_query_hybrid`: Dense + sparse search
- `pinecone_fetch`: Retrieve vectors by ID

### Vector Operations
- `pinecone_upsert`: Insert/update vectors
- `pinecone_update`: Update metadata or values
- `pinecone_delete`: Remove vectors

### Index Management
- `pinecone_create_index`: Create new index
- `pinecone_delete_index`: Remove index
- `pinecone_describe_index`: Get index info
- `pinecone_list_indexes`: List all indexes
- `pinecone_index_stats`: Get statistics

### Namespace Operations
- `pinecone_list_namespaces`: List namespaces
- `pinecone_delete_namespace`: Remove namespace

## Performance Optimization

### Batching Strategies
- Automatic batch splitting for large upserts
- Parallel query execution
- Connection pooling

### Caching
- Index metadata caching
- Namespace list caching
- Query result caching (optional)

## Error Handling
- Rate limit handling with exponential backoff
- Index not ready states
- Dimension mismatch detection
- Invalid filter syntax errors

## Monitoring & Observability
- Query latency metrics
- Upsert throughput
- Index utilization
- Namespace distribution
- Cost tracking

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Core Operations (Week 1-2)
- [ ] Authentication setup
- [ ] Basic query operations
- [ ] Upsert/delete vectors
- [ ] Metadata filtering

### Phase 2: Advanced Features (Week 3-4)
- [ ] Namespace management
- [ ] Hybrid search
- [ ] Batch operations
- [ ] Collection management

### Phase 3: Production (Week 5)
- [ ] Performance optimization
- [ ] Error handling
- [ ] Monitoring integration
- [ ] Documentation

## Dependencies
- pinecone-client SDK
- numpy (for vector operations)
- aiohttp (async support)

## Success Metrics
- Query latency < 100ms (p95)
- Upsert throughput > 1000 vectors/second
- 99.9% uptime for operations
- Zero data loss on upserts

fcp.cron: Scheduled Task Runner
description:
# Scheduled Task Runner Meta-Connector

**Force Multiplier:** Time-based automation for FCP zones.

## Overview

Many automation workflows require scheduled execution: daily reports, periodic syncs, cleanup jobs, reminder systems. This meta-connector provides a robust scheduling infrastructure that triggers FCP actions on time-based schedules.

## Core Components

### 1. Cron Expression Scheduling
- Standard cron syntax (5-field and 6-field)
- Extended syntax with seconds precision
- Timezone-aware scheduling
- Named schedules for common patterns
- Cron expression validation and preview

```
# Standard patterns
@hourly    = 0 * * * *
@daily     = 0 0 * * *
@weekly    = 0 0 * * 0
@monthly   = 0 0 1 * *

# Custom patterns
*/15 * * * *     = Every 15 minutes
0 9 * * 1-5      = 9 AM on weekdays
0 0 1,15 * *     = 1st and 15th of month
```

### 2. One-Time Scheduled Tasks
- Schedule task for specific datetime
- Support for relative scheduling ("in 30 minutes")
- Cancellation before execution
- Rescheduling capability
- Batch scheduling (multiple one-time tasks)

### 3. Interval-Based Triggers
- Fixed interval execution (every N minutes/hours/days)
- Sliding window intervals
- Jitter support for load distribution
- Minimum interval enforcement
- Pause/resume capability

### 4. Task History and Logs
- Complete execution history
- Stdout/stderr capture
- Execution duration tracking
- Success/failure status
- Searchable log storage
- Log retention policies

### 5. Failure Alerting
- Configurable alert channels (email, Slack, PagerDuty)
- Alert on:
  - Task failure
  - Task timeout
  - Consecutive failures
  - Missed schedules
- Alert suppression/snooze
- Escalation policies

## Configuration Example

```toml
[[schedules]]
name = "daily-backup"
cron = "0 2 * * *"
timezone = "America/New_York"
action = "zone.backup.run_backup"
params = { full = true }
timeout = "1h"
alert_on_failure = true

[[schedules]]
name = "hourly-sync"
interval = "1h"
jitter = "5m"
action = "zone.sync.pull_updates"
retry_on_failure = 3

[[one_time]]
name = "migration-task"
run_at = "2024-02-01T03:00:00Z"
action = "zone.db.run_migration"
params = { version = "v2.0" }
```

## Task State Machine

```
PENDING â†’ RUNNING â†’ COMPLETED
              â†“
           FAILED â†’ RETRYING â†’ COMPLETED/FAILED
              â†“
         DEAD (max retries exceeded)
```

## Dashboard Features

- Calendar view of scheduled tasks
- Next N upcoming executions
- Recent execution history
- Live execution monitoring
- Manual trigger capability
- Bulk operations (pause all, resume all)

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Sub-second scheduling precision
- [ ] Support 1000+ concurrent schedules
- [ ] Missed task detection and alerting
- [ ] Distributed execution (no single point of failure)
- [ ] Complete audit trail
- [ ] Hot-reload of schedule configurations

## Dependencies

- Persistent storage for schedules and history
- Time synchronization (NTP)
- Alert channel integrations
- Zone action invocation system

## Considerations

- Handle daylight saving time transitions
- Cluster-safe (only one instance executes)
- Graceful shutdown (complete running tasks)
- Clock skew tolerance
- Long-running task support

title: fcp.cron: Scheduled Task Runner Connector
description: Time-based automation connector. Cron expression scheduling, one-time scheduled tasks, interval-based triggers, task history and logs, failure alerting. Enables agents to schedule recurring tasks like daily email summaries, weekly reports, nightly security scans.

title: fcp.linear - Linear Issue Tracking Connector
description:
# fcp.linear - Linear Issue Tracking Connector

## Overview
Complete Linear integration enabling bidirectional sync between Flywheel Beads and Linear issues with full project management capabilities.

## Archetype
**Hybrid: Request-Response + Webhook + Bidirectional Sync**
- Request-Response: GraphQL API for all CRUD operations
- Webhook: Real-time event notifications
- Bidirectional: Beads<->Issues sync protocol

## Key Operations

### Issue Operations
- `linear.issue.create` - Create issue with full metadata
- `linear.issue.update` - Update issue fields
- `linear.issue.delete` - Archive/delete issue
- `linear.issue.get` - Get issue by ID or identifier
- `linear.issue.list` - List issues with filters
- `linear.issue.search` - Full-text search
- `linear.issue.move` - Move between projects/teams
- `linear.issue.assign` - Assign to user
- `linear.issue.subscribe` - Subscribe to issue updates
- `linear.issue.relations` - Manage issue relationships (blocks, relates, duplicates)

### Comment Operations
- `linear.comment.create` - Add comment to issue
- `linear.comment.update` - Edit comment
- `linear.comment.delete` - Remove comment
- `linear.comment.list` - List issue comments
- `linear.comment.reactions` - Add/remove emoji reactions

### Project Operations
- `linear.project.create` - Create project
- `linear.project.update` - Update project settings
- `linear.project.list` - List team projects
- `linear.project.milestones` - Manage milestones
- `linear.project.roadmap` - Access roadmap view data

### Cycle/Sprint Operations
- `linear.cycle.create` - Create new cycle
- `linear.cycle.update` - Modify cycle dates/scope
- `linear.cycle.current` - Get active cycle
- `linear.cycle.upcoming` - List upcoming cycles
- `linear.cycle.issues` - Get cycle issues with stats

### Team Operations
- `linear.team.list` - List accessible teams
- `linear.team.members` - Get team members
- `linear.team.labels` - Manage team labels
- `linear.team.states` - Get workflow states
- `linear.team.templates` - Access issue templates

### User Operations
- `linear.user.me` - Get authenticated user
- `linear.user.get` - Get user by ID
- `linear.user.assigned` - Get user assigned issues

### Webhook Operations
- `linear.webhook.create` - Register webhook
- `linear.webhook.delete` - Remove webhook
- `linear.webhook.list` - List active webhooks

## GraphQL Implementation
- Full GraphQL client with query builder
- Automatic pagination (cursor-based)
- Query batching and deduplication
- Subscription support via WebSocket
- Fragment reuse for common types
- Query complexity estimation

## Bidirectional Beads Sync Protocol
```
Flywheel Bead <-----> Linear Issue
    |                     |
    +-- title --------> title
    +-- description --> description (markdown)
    +-- status -------> state (mapped)
    +-- priority -----> priority (1-4 scale)
    +-- assignee -----> assignee
    +-- labels -------> labels
    +-- parent -------> parent issue
    +-- due_date -----> dueDate
    +-- estimate -----> estimate (points)
```

### Sync Rules
- Conflict resolution: Last-write-wins with audit trail
- Field mapping configuration per workspace
- Selective sync (filter which beads sync)
- Sync status tracking per bead

## Zone Architecture
```
Zone 0 (Public):     N/A (Linear has no public data)
Zone 1 (Authorized): Issues, projects, cycles (workspace scoped)
Zone 2 (Private):    Comments, attachments, user data
Zone 3 (Sensitive):  API keys, OAuth tokens, webhook secrets
```

## Dependencies
- `fcp-core`: Base connector traits
- `fcp-graphql`: GraphQL client infrastructure
- `fcp-webhook`: Webhook endpoint management
- `fcp-sync`: Bidirectional sync engine

## Integration Points
- **Flywheel Beads**: Primary sync target
- **Flywheel Agents**: Auto-triage and assignment
- **fcp.github**: Link PRs to Linear issues
- **fcp.slack**: Issue notifications to channels

## Implementation Notes
- Use Linear SDK as reference for GraphQL schema
- Implement issue identifier parsing (TEAM-123)
- Handle workspace switching for multi-org users
- Support custom fields and views
- Implement batch operations for bulk updates
- Rate limit: 1500 requests per hour (track via headers)

fcp.browser - Headless Browser Automation Connector
description:
# FCP Browser Connector - Headless Browser Automation

## Overview
A comprehensive headless browser automation connector built on Chromium (chromiumoxide crate) that enables agents to navigate websites, extract data, fill forms, handle authentication, and perform visual verification tasks.

## Priority: P1 (Critical Infrastructure)

## Core Capabilities

### 1. Navigation & Page Control
- Navigate to any URL with configurable timeouts
- Handle redirects and page loads
- Back/forward navigation
- Tab management (open, close, switch)
- Iframe handling
- Wait for selectors, network idle, or custom conditions

### 2. Form Interaction
- Fill text inputs, textareas
- Select dropdowns and multi-selects
- Check/uncheck checkboxes and radio buttons
- File upload handling
- Form submission with validation
- Auto-fill from structured data

### 3. Data Extraction
- CSS selector-based extraction
- XPath queries
- Extract text, attributes, HTML
- Table parsing to structured data
- List extraction with pagination handling
- JSON-LD and structured data extraction

### 4. Authentication Flows
- Basic auth handling
- OAuth 2.0 flow support
- Multi-factor authentication hooks
- Session token extraction
- Cookie-based session persistence
- Credential vault integration

### 5. Visual Operations
- Full page screenshots
- Element screenshots
- PDF generation with options (paper size, margins, headers/footers)
- Visual diff/comparison
- Viewport configuration

### 6. Cookie & Session Management
- Get/set/delete cookies
- Session storage access
- Local storage access
- Session persistence across invocations
- Cookie jar import/export

### 7. JavaScript Execution
- Execute arbitrary JS in page context
- Evaluate expressions and return results
- Inject scripts before page load
- Intercept and modify network requests
- Console log capture

### 8. Stealth & Anti-Detection
- Stealth mode for bot detection avoidance
- Randomized user agents
- Human-like mouse movements
- Typing delays and patterns
- WebGL/Canvas fingerprint randomization
- Timezone and locale spoofing

### 9. Proxy & Network
- Proxy rotation support (HTTP, SOCKS5)
- Proxy authentication
- Request interception
- Response modification
- Network throttling
- Certificate handling

## FCP Integration

### Manifest Structure
```toml
[connector]
name = "fcp.browser"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "Headless browser automation for web scraping and interaction"

[capabilities]
navigate = { risk = "low", description = "Navigate to URLs" }
extract = { risk = "low", description = "Extract data from pages" }
fill_form = { risk = "medium", description = "Fill and submit forms" }
execute_js = { risk = "high", description = "Execute JavaScript in page context" }
screenshot = { risk = "low", description = "Capture screenshots" }
manage_cookies = { risk = "medium", description = "Read/write cookies and sessions" }

[trust_zones]
default = "z:web:browsing"
form_submission = "z:web:interaction"
js_execution = "z:web:scripted"

[resources]
memory_mb = 512
timeout_default_ms = 30000
max_concurrent_pages = 5
```

### Tool Definitions
```yaml
tools:
  - name: browser_navigate
    description: Navigate to a URL and wait for page load
    parameters:
      url: { type: string, required: true }
      wait_for: { type: string, enum: [load, domcontentloaded, networkidle] }
      timeout_ms: { type: integer, default: 30000 }

  - name: browser_extract
    description: Extract data from current page
    parameters:
      selector: { type: string, required: true }
      attribute: { type: string }
      multiple: { type: boolean, default: false }

  - name: browser_fill
    description: Fill a form field
    parameters:
      selector: { type: string, required: true }
      value: { type: string, required: true }
      clear_first: { type: boolean, default: true }

  - name: browser_click
    description: Click an element
    parameters:
      selector: { type: string, required: true }
      wait_for_navigation: { type: boolean, default: false }

  - name: browser_screenshot
    description: Capture screenshot
    parameters:
      full_page: { type: boolean, default: false }
      selector: { type: string }
      format: { type: string, enum: [png, jpeg, webp] }

  - name: browser_pdf
    description: Generate PDF from page
    parameters:
      paper_size: { type: string, default: "A4" }
      landscape: { type: boolean, default: false }
      print_background: { type: boolean, default: true }

  - name: browser_execute_js
    description: Execute JavaScript in page context
    parameters:
      script: { type: string, required: true }
      await_promise: { type: boolean, default: true }
```

## Security Considerations
- URL allowlist/blocklist support
- Content Security Policy respect option
- Credential isolation per session
- No cross-session data leakage
- Audit logging of all navigation and form submissions
- Rate limiting per domain

## Dependencies
- chromiumoxide (Rust Chromium DevTools Protocol)
- tokio (async runtime)
- serde (serialization)
- url (URL parsing)

## Implementation Notes
- Browser instance pooling for performance
- Lazy initialization of Chromium
- Graceful shutdown with page cleanup
- Memory limits per page
- Automatic crash recovery

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Navigate to any URL and extract page title
- [ ] Fill and submit a login form
- [ ] Extract table data as JSON
- [ ] Generate PDF from webpage
- [ ] Handle sites with bot detection
- [ ] Persist session across multiple tool calls
- [ ] Execute custom JavaScript and return results
- [ ] Rotate through proxy list

fcp.anthropic - Anthropic AI Provider Connector
description:
# FCP Anthropic Connector - Anthropic AI Provider

## Overview
A comprehensive connector for Anthropic's Claude API, enabling agents to leverage Claude models for complex reasoning, tool use, vision capabilities, and batch processing with built-in cost tracking and budget enforcement.

## Priority: P1 (Critical Infrastructure)

## Core Capabilities

### 1. Messages API
- Send messages to Claude models
- Streaming responses for real-time output
- Multi-turn conversations
- System prompts
- Model selection (claude-opus-4-5-20251101, claude-sonnet-4-20250514, claude-haiku, etc.)
- Temperature and sampling controls
- Max tokens configuration
- Stop sequences

### 2. Tool Use Support
- Define tools with JSON schema
- Handle tool_use responses
- Execute tools and return results
- Multi-tool conversations
- Parallel tool execution
- Tool choice forcing (auto, any, specific)

### 3. Vision Capabilities
- Images in prompts (base64 or URL)
- Multiple images per message
- Image analysis and description
- Document/screenshot understanding
- Chart and diagram interpretation

### 4. Prompt Caching
- Cache system prompts
- Cache large context documents
- Cache tool definitions
- Automatic cache management
- Cache hit/miss tracking
- Cost savings calculation

### 5. Batch API
- Submit batch requests
- Track batch status
- Retrieve batch results
- Cancel batches
- Cost-efficient bulk processing
- 50% cost reduction for batch jobs

### 6. Cost Tracking & Budget Enforcement
- Per-request cost calculation
- Running total tracking
- Budget limits per agent/session
- Alerts at thresholds
- Automatic cutoff at budget limit
- Cost attribution and reporting

## FCP Integration

### Manifest Structure
```toml
[connector]
name = "fcp.anthropic"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "Anthropic Claude API integration with cost tracking"

[capabilities]
messages = { risk = "medium", description = "Send messages to Claude" }
streaming = { risk = "medium", description = "Stream responses" }
tool_use = { risk = "medium", description = "Use tools in conversations" }
vision = { risk = "medium", description = "Process images" }
batch = { risk = "low", description = "Submit batch requests" }

[trust_zones]
default = "z:ai:inference"

[resources]
rate_limit_rpm = 1000
rate_limit_tpm = 100000
default_timeout_ms = 120000

[billing]
track_costs = true
budget_enforcement = true
```

### Tool Definitions
```yaml
tools:
  - name: anthropic_message
    description: Send a message to Claude
    parameters:
      model: 
        type: string
        enum: [claude-opus-4-5-20251101, claude-sonnet-4-20250514, claude-3-5-haiku-20241022]
        required: true
      messages:
        type: array
        items:
          type: object
          properties:
            role: { type: string, enum: [user, assistant] }
            content: { type: string }
        required: true
      system: { type: string }
      max_tokens: { type: integer, default: 4096 }
      temperature: { type: number, default: 1.0, min: 0, max: 1 }
      stream: { type: boolean, default: false }

  - name: anthropic_message_with_tools
    description: Send a message with tool definitions
    parameters:
      model: { type: string, required: true }
      messages: { type: array, required: true }
      tools:
        type: array
        items:
          type: object
          properties:
            name: { type: string }
            description: { type: string }
            input_schema: { type: object }
      tool_choice: 
        type: object
        properties:
          type: { type: string, enum: [auto, any, tool] }
          name: { type: string }

  - name: anthropic_message_with_vision
    description: Send a message with images
    parameters:
      model: { type: string, required: true }
      messages:
        type: array
        items:
          type: object
          properties:
            role: { type: string }
            content:
              type: array
              items:
                oneOf:
                  - type: object
                    properties:
                      type: { const: text }
                      text: { type: string }
                  - type: object
                    properties:
                      type: { const: image }
                      source:
                        type: object
                        properties:
                          type: { enum: [base64, url] }
                          media_type: { type: string }
                          data: { type: string }

  - name: anthropic_batch_create
    description: Create a batch request
    parameters:
      requests:
        type: array
        items:
          type: object
          properties:
            custom_id: { type: string }
            params: { type: object }
        required: true

  - name: anthropic_batch_status
    description: Get batch status
    parameters:
      batch_id: { type: string, required: true }

  - name: anthropic_batch_results
    description: Get batch results
    parameters:
      batch_id: { type: string, required: true }

  - name: anthropic_get_usage
    description: Get current usage and costs
    parameters:
      period: { type: string, enum: [session, day, month] }
```

## Cost Tracking

### Pricing Model (as of implementation)
| Model | Input (per 1M tokens) | Output (per 1M tokens) |
|-------|----------------------|------------------------|
| claude-opus-4-5-20251101 | $15.00 | $75.00 |
| claude-sonnet-4-20250514 | $3.00 | $15.00 |
| claude-3-5-haiku | $0.25 | $1.25 |

### Budget Enforcement
```rust
struct BudgetConfig {
    max_per_request: Option<f64>,
    max_per_session: Option<f64>,
    max_per_day: Option<f64>,
    warning_threshold: f64,  // 0.0 - 1.0
}
```

### Cost Attribution
- Track costs per agent
- Track costs per task/session
- Track costs per tool
- Generate reports

## Prompt Caching Strategy
- System prompts > 1024 tokens: Always cache
- Tool definitions: Cache when > 5 tools
- Large documents: Cache with TTL
- Cache warming on connector init

## Error Handling
- Rate limit (429): Exponential backoff
- Overloaded (529): Queue and retry
- Invalid request (400): Parse and report
- Auth failure (401): Refresh credentials
- Context length exceeded: Truncation strategy

## Dependencies
- anthropic-rs or custom HTTP client
- reqwest (HTTP)
- tokio (async)
- serde (serialization)
- async-stream (streaming)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Send basic message and receive response
- [ ] Stream response tokens in real-time
- [ ] Use tools in conversation
- [ ] Process images in prompts
- [ ] Submit and retrieve batch jobs
- [ ] Track costs accurately per request
- [ ] Enforce budget limits
- [ ] Handle rate limits gracefully
- [ ] Utilize prompt caching

description:
# fcp.youtube - YouTube Data & Studio API Connector

## Overview
Full YouTube integration covering video discovery, transcript extraction, analytics, and content management for media-rich Flywheel workflows.

**Hybrid: Request-Response + Polling**
- Request-Response: Data API for search, metadata, comments
- Polling: Analytics updates, processing status checks

### Upload Operations (Resumable Upload)
- `youtube.upload.init` - Initialize resumable upload
- `youtube.upload.chunk` - Upload video chunk
- `youtube.upload.status` - Check upload status
- `youtube.upload.resume` - Resume interrupted upload
- `youtube.upload.finalize` - Complete upload
- `youtube.upload.thumbnail` - Set video thumbnail

### Live Streaming Operations
- `youtube.live.broadcast.create` - Create broadcast
- `youtube.live.broadcast.bind` - Bind to stream
- `youtube.live.broadcast.transition` - Change broadcast state
- `youtube.live.stream.create` - Create live stream
- `youtube.live.chat.messages` - Get live chat messages
- `youtube.live.chat.send` - Send chat message

## Quota Management
YouTube API has complex quota system:
- Read operations: 1-100 units
- Write operations: 50-1600 units
- Daily quota: 10,000 units default

### Quota Strategy
- Query cost pre-calculation
- Quota budget allocation per workflow
- Caching layer to reduce redundant calls
- Batch requests where possible
- parts parameter optimization

## Zone Architecture
```
Zone 0 (Public):     Public video metadata, search results
Zone 1 (Authorized): User watch history, subscriptions
Zone 2 (Private):    Analytics data, unlisted videos
Zone 3 (Sensitive):  OAuth tokens, API keys
```

## Dependencies
- `fcp-core`: Base connector traits
- `fcp-oauth`: Google OAuth 2.0 flow
- `fcp-upload`: Resumable upload handling
- `fcp-cache`: Metadata caching

## Integration Points
- **Flywheel Media**: Video content indexing
- **Flywheel Knowledge**: Transcript ingestion for RAG
- **fcp.openai**: Transcript summarization
- **fcp.whisper**: Alternative transcription

## Implementation Notes
- Use YouTube Data API v3
- Implement exponential backoff for quota errors
- Cache video metadata (TTL: 1 hour)
- Support both API key and OAuth authentication
- Handle regional restrictions gracefully
- Implement proper ISO 8601 duration parsing
- Support snippet, contentDetails, statistics parts
- Handle live vs. uploaded vs. premiere video types

# Study: Clawdbot Discord Connector Implementation

## Objective

Research and document the existing clawdbot Discord connector implementation to extract patterns, learnings, and reusable components for building FCP connectors.

## Research Areas

### 1. Architecture Overview
- [ ] Overall connector structure
- [ ] Module organization
- [ ] Dependency graph
- [ ] Configuration management
- [ ] Entry point and initialization

### 2. Discord API Integration
- [ ] Gateway connection handling
- [ ] REST API usage patterns
- [ ] Rate limiting implementation
- [ ] Retry logic and backoff
- [ ] Error handling strategies

### 3. Event Handling
- [ ] Event subscription model
- [ ] Event parsing and validation
- [ ] Event dispatching mechanism
- [ ] Event filtering capabilities
- [ ] Async event processing

### 4. Authentication & Security
- [ ] Token management
- [ ] Permission handling
- [ ] Credential storage patterns
- [ ] Security best practices used

### 5. Message Processing
- [ ] Message parsing
- [ ] Command extraction
- [ ] Response formatting
- [ ] Attachment handling
- [ ] Embed construction

### 6. State Management
- [ ] Guild/server state tracking
- [ ] User session management
- [ ] Cache strategies
- [ ] Persistence patterns

### 7. Testing Approach
- [ ] Unit test patterns
- [ ] Integration test setup
- [ ] Mock strategies for Discord API
- [ ] Test coverage areas

## Deliverables

1. **Architecture Diagram** - Visual representation of connector structure
2. **Pattern Catalog** - Documented patterns that can be reused
3. **Anti-Pattern Notes** - What to avoid based on learnings
4. **Reusable Components List** - Code/patterns that can be extracted
5. **Recommendations** - Suggestions for FCP connector design

## Questions to Answer

- How does clawdbot handle Discord's rate limits?
- What reconnection strategy is used for the gateway?
- How are slash commands registered and handled?
- How is state synchronized across restarts?
- What logging/observability patterns are used?

## Resources

- Clawdbot repository
- Discord.js/Discord.py documentation (for comparison)
- Discord API documentation
- Existing connector documentation

## Time Estimate

- Research: 4-6 hours
- Documentation: 2-3 hours
- Total: 6-9 hours
